node.title: Two men jailed for assassinating Malcolm X will be exonerated, 55 years after being convicted
node.alt: A black man in a corduroy suit with his finger on his face.
node.description: Muhammad Aziz and Khalil Islam always denied they were involved in the 1965 assassination of the civil rights spokesman. Now New York's top prosecutor says they "did not get the justice that they deserved".
node.content:
["Two of the three men convicted over the 1965\u00a0assassination of Malcolm X are set to be cleared\u00a0after insisting on their innocence for more than five decades.", "Prosecutors now say authorities withheld evidence that favoured the defence in the trial of Muhammad Aziz, now 83, and the late Khalil Islam, according to The New York Times.", "Mr Aziz and Mr Islam spent decades in prison for the crime, but a recent documentary sparked a nearly two-year investigation by their lawyers and the Manhattan district attorney's office.", "\"These men did not get the justice that they deserved,\" Manhattan District Attorney Cyrus Vance Jr told the Times.", "Mr Vance later tweeted that his office, along with\u00a0the Innocence Project and the office of civil rights lawyer David Shanies,\u00a0would ask a judge to toss out the convictions.", "", "
Muhammad Aziz spent decades in prison for the murder but always said he was\u00a0innocent.(AP: File)
", "One of the civil rights era's most controversial and compelling figures, Malcolm X rose to fame as the Nation of Islam's chief spokesperson.", "The Nation called for racial separatism, with Malcolm X urging black people to\u00a0claim civil rights \"by any means necessary\".", "He split from the Nation of Islam about a year before he was gunned down as he began a speech in Harlem's Audubon Ballroom on February\u00a021, 1965.", "Mr Aziz, Mr Islam and a third man, Mujahid Abdul Halim \u2014 known at the time of the killing as Talmadge Hayer and also as Thomas Hagan \u2014 were convicted of murder in March 1966 and sentenced to life in prison.", "Hagan said he was one of three gunmen who shot Malcolm X, but he testified that neither Mr Aziz nor Mr Islam was involved.", "The two, then known as Norman 3X Butler and Thomas 15X Johnson, maintained throughout that they were innocent and offered alibis at their 1966 trial. No physical evidence linked them to the crime.", "\"Thomas 15X Johnson and Norman 3X Butler had nothing to do with this crime whatsoever,\" Hagan said in a sworn statement in 1977.", "Hagan was paroled in 2010.", "He identified two other men as gunmen, but no-one else was ever arrested.", "", "
Khalil Islam declared his desire to be exonerated before his death in 2009.(AP: File)
", "According to The New York Times, the re-investigation found the FBI had documents that pointed to other suspects, and a still-living witness supported Mr Aziz's alibi \u2014 that he was at home with a leg injury at the time of the shooting.", "The witness, who\u00a0authorities had never interviewed before and who was identified only by the initials \"JM\", said he spoke to Mr Aziz on the latter's home phone on the day of the killing, the newspaper said.", "Also, the review found that prosecutors knew about but didn't disclose that undercover officers were in the ballroom when the gunfire erupted, and police knew that someone had called the Daily News of New York earlier that day saying that Malcolm X would be killed.", "\"This wasn't a mere oversight,\" Deborah Francois, a lawyer for Mr Aziz and Mr Islam, told the Times.", "\"This was a product of extreme and gross official misconduct.\"", "", "
Malcolm X was assassinated in the\u00a0Audubon ballroom, in Harlem, a year after leaving the Nation of Islam.(AP: Al Burleigh/File)
", "Mr Aziz was released in 1985. Mr Islam was released two years later and died in 2009.", "\"I need to be exonerated,\" Mr Islam said in a 2008 talk at a Harlem bookstore. \"I had to walk 22 years in prison.\"", "The Manhattan district attorney's office publicly acknowledged it was considering reopening the case after Netflix aired the documentary series Who Killed Malcom X?\u00a0last year.", "The series explored a theory\u00a0that the two men were innocent and that some of the real killers had escaped.", "AP"]
